be.ac.ulb.crashcoin.common

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Transaction>
          • be.ac.ulb.crashcoin.common.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONable, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Transaction>, Collection<Transaction>, List<Transaction>, RandomAccess

    public class Block
extends ArrayList<Transaction>
implements JSONable
    Block that compose BlockChain. A block contains a header and a body. The header is a compact representation of all informations in the block and is meant to he hashed. The body contains detailed information about all or part of the transactions, within a merkle tree. Contents of the header: - nonce value (4 bytes) - hash of the previous block (32 bytes = 256 bits) - merkle tree root (32 bytes) - mining difficulty (expected 0s at the beginning of the hash, 4 bytes)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • findTransaction

        public Transaction findTransaction(byte[] hashed)
        Checks that a transaction is indeed present inside of the block, given its hash. Then, if a transaction hash is matched, it returns the corresponding transaction. Otherwise it returns null.
        Parameters:
        hashed - Transaction hash value
        Returns:
        Whether it is present in the blok or not
